briefdescription.para: Inherit only the translation component from the parent.

detaileddescription.para: The child's world position is offset by the parent's world position, but rotation and scale remain unaffected by the parent.

briefdescription.para: Inherit only the rotation component from the parent.

detaileddescription.para: The child's orientation is combined with the parent's orientation, but position and scale remain unaffected.

briefdescription.para: Inherit only the scale component from the parent.

detaileddescription.para: The child's scale is multiplied by the parent's scale, but position and rotation remain unaffected.

briefdescription.para: Inherit all transform components (Translation, Rotation, Scale).

detaileddescription.para: This is the default behavior where the child's world transform is the full composition of parent and local transforms.

briefdescription.para: Bitmask enum controlling which transform components a child node inherits from its parent.

detaileddescription.para: When a SceneNode is attached to a parent, its final world transform is computed by combining the parent's world transform with the child's local transform. The `Inherit` flags determine which components (Translation, Rotation, Scale) of the parent transform are applied to the child.

This enables flexible scene graph behaviors such as:
A camera that follows an object's position but maintains its own orientation (`TransformType::Translation`)
UI elements that inherit full transforms (`TransformType::All`)
Objects that only inherit rotation for billboard effects (`TransformType::Rotation`)
Example usage: ```cpp using namespace helios::math;
// Camera follows spaceship position only cameraNode->setInheritance(TransformType::Translation);
// Full transform inheritance (default) childNode->setInheritance(TransformType::All);
// Combine specific flags node->setInheritance(TransformType::Translation | TransformType::Rotation); ```

memberdef.definition: using helios::math::FloatingPointType = std::conditional_t< std::is_floating_point_v<T>, T, double >
memberdef.name: FloatingPointType

briefdescription.para: Type trait that promotes integral types to double, while preserving floating-point types.

parameterdescription.para: the input type

briefdescription.para: Single-precision floating-point AABB.
Integer AABB.
Unsigned Integer AABB.
Double-precision floating-point AABB.
Type alias for a 4x4 float matrix.
Type alias for a 4x4 double matrix.
Type alias for a 4x4 integer matrix.
Single-precision floating-point 3D vector.
Integer 3D vector.
Double-precision floating-point 3D vector.
Single-precision floating-point 4D vector.
Double-precision floating-point 4D vector.
Integer 4D vector.
Unit vector along the positive X-axis (1, 0, 0).

detaileddescription.para: Commonly used as the default "right" direction in helios's left-handed coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Unit vector along the positive Y-axis (0, 1, 0).

detaileddescription.para: Commonly used as the default "up" direction in helios's left-handed coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: Unit vector along the positive Z-axis (0, 0, 1).

detaileddescription.para: Commonly used as the default "forward" direction in helios's left-handed coordinate system.

briefdescription.para: A small epsilon value used for length-based comparisons.

detaileddescription.para: This constant represents the minimum threshold value for length comparisons to account for numerical precision errors in floating-point calculations. It is often used to avoid treating very small values as significant, effectively filtering out noise in computations that involve vector-lengths.

memberdef.argsstring: (float fovY, float aspect, float zNear, float zFar) noexcept
memberdef.name: perspective

briefdescription.para: Computes the 4x4 perspective projection matrix based on the specified field of view, aspect ratio, and near and far clipping planes.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns a matrix suitable for projecting 3D points onto a 2D screen from the perspective of a camera. The perspective transformation maps 3D points inside the specified viewing frustum to normalized device coordinates, which are then clipped and transformed to screen space.

parameterdescription.para: Field of view in the Y direction, specified in radians.
The aspect ratio of the view, defined as width divided by height.
The distance to the near clipping plane. Must be greater than zero.
The distance to the far clipping plane. Must be greater than zNear.

simplesect.para: A 4x4 matrix representing the perspective projection transformation.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float left, const float right, const float bottom, const float top, const float zNear=0.1f, const float zFar=100.0f) noexcept
memberdef.name: ortho

briefdescription.para: Computes the 4x4 orthographic projection matrix.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a projection matrix that maps 3D coordinates to normalized device coordinates without perspective distortion. Parallel lines remain parallel, and object size does not change with distance from the camera.
Suitable for 2D rendering, UI elements, and technical visualizations.

parameterdescription.para: The left boundary of the view volume.
The right boundary of the view volume.
The bottom boundary of the view volume.
The top boundary of the view volume.
The distance to the near clipping plane (default: 0.1).
The distance to the far clipping plane (default: 100.0).

simplesect.para: A 4x4 orthographic projection matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const vec3f &eye, const vec3f &center, const vec3f &up) noexcept
memberdef.name: lookAt

briefdescription.para: Returns the 4x4 lookAt-matrix for transforming world coordinates to camera space. The method creates the camera coordinate system based on the parameters eye, i.e. the vantage point in world space, the camera's up direction and center, representing the point of interest. Note that the returned matrix is essentially a composition of a change of coordinates matrix P(C <- W) and a translation to the origin, i.e. the camera is sitting at the origin (0, 0, 0) looking down the negative z-axis, i.e. conceptually.

detaileddescription.para: P(W<-C) * T(-eye)
The 4x4 matrix can then be used for computing the perspective projection for creating the clip space
clip = P * V * W * M

memberdef.argsstring: (const mat4f &model, float radians, const vec3f &axis) noexcept
memberdef.name: rotate

briefdescription.para: Creates an affine rotation matrix R' = M * R by "baking" the rotation part into the model matrix. Any operation R' * v will make sure that v is rotated around the local origin, then transformed into world space.

memberdef.argsstring: (const mat4f &model, const vec3f &v) noexcept
memberdef.name: translate

briefdescription.para: Creates an affine transformation matrix M' = M * T by "baking" the translation part into the model matrix. Any operation M' * v will make sure that v is translated in local space, then transformed into world space.

memberdef.argsstring: (const mat4f &model, const vec3f &v) noexcept
memberdef.name: scale

briefdescription.para: Creates an affine transformation matrix S' = M * S by ""baking" the scaling part into the model matrix. Any operation S' * v will make sure that v is scaled in local space, then transformed into world space.

memberdef.argsstring: (const mat4f &model, const float scale_by) noexcept
memberdef.name: scale

briefdescription.para: Creates an affine transformation matrix S' = M * S by "baking" the scaling part into the model matrix. Any operation S' * v will make sure that v is scaled in local space, then transformed into world space.

memberdef.argsstring: (TransformType a, TransformType b)
memberdef.name: operator|

briefdescription.para: Combines two Inherit flags using bitwise OR.

parameterdescription.para: The first inheritance flag.
The second inheritance flag.

simplesect.para: The combined inheritance mask.

memberdef.argsstring: (TransformType mask, TransformType flag)
memberdef.name: transformTypeMatch

briefdescription.para: Checks if a specific inheritance flag is set in a mask.

detaileddescription.para:
mask
The inheritance mask to check against.
flag
The specific flag to test for.
`true` if the flag is present in the mask, `false` otherwise.
Example usage: ```cpp using namespace helios::math;
TransformType mode = TransformType::Translation | TransformType::Rotation;
if (transformTypeMatch(mode, TransformType::Translation)) { // Apply parent translation... } ```

memberdef.argsstring: (const helios::math::aabb< T > a, const helios::math::aabb< T > b) noexcept
memberdef.name: overlap

briefdescription.para: Computes the signed dimensions of the overlapping region between two axis-aligned bounding boxes (AABBs).

detaileddescription.para: Given two AABBs, this function calculates the intersection bounds along each axis. The resulting vector represents the size (extents) of the intersection.

parameterdescription.para: The numeric type used for the vector components (e.g., `float` or `double`).
The first AABB.
The second AABB.

simplesect.para: A 3D vector representing the dimensions of the overlapping region between the AABBs. If no overlap exists, the resulting vector may contain non-positive values in one or more components.

memberdef.argsstring: (const helios::math::aabb< T > a, const helios::math::aabb< T > b) noexcept
memberdef.name: overlapCenter

briefdescription.para: Computes the center of intersection of the overlapping region between two axis-aligned bounding boxes (AABBs).

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the center of the intersection region of the two AABBs. If the AABBs do not overlap, the returned value represents the midpoint of the gap between them.

parameterdescription.para: The numeric type used for the vector components (e.g., `float` or `double`).
The first AABB.
The second AABB.

simplesect.para: A 3D vector representing the center point of the overlapping or gapping region between the AABBs.

memberdef.argsstring: (const helios::math::aabb< T > aabb, const helios::math::vec3< T > v) noexcept
memberdef.name: operator+

briefdescription.para: Adds a translation vector to an AABB.

detaileddescription.para: This operator overload allows the addition of a translation vector to an axis-aligned bounding box (AABB), resulting in a new translated AABB.

parameterdescription.para: The numeric type of the vector components (e.g., `float` or `double`).
The AABB to be translated.
The translation vector to apply.

simplesect.para: A new AABB translated by the given vector.

memberdef.argsstring: (const helios::math::aabb< T > &aabb, const helios::math::vec3< T > v) noexcept
memberdef.name: operator*

briefdescription.para: Scales an AABB by a given vector.

detaileddescription.para: This operator overload allows scaling of an axis-aligned bounding box (AABB) by multiplying its min and max points with the given vector.

parameterdescription.para: The numeric type of the vector components.
The AABB to be scaled.
The scaling vector, for which only positive values are allowed.

simplesect.para: A new AABB scaled by the given vector.

briefdescription.para: Mathematical operations and types.

detaileddescription.para: This namespace provides comprehensive mathematical functionality including vector and matrix types, transformation utilities, mathematical concepts, and utility functions for 3D graphics and game framework computations. Provides all mathematical operations required for 3D graphics, including transformations, projections, and spatial computations.
